The previous two hundred twenty-one sutras,
are all composed by later people according to their own preferences.
Within the great texts,
they are excerpted and circulated separately.
Some take a verse or phrase,
and make it into a scroll or chapter.
As this spreads in the latter years,
the deceptions and abuses increase daily.
Now it is appropriate to include them to strengthen the foundation.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:

The Sutra of the Essential Collection of All Buddhas in one fascicle, the Sutra of the Essential Wisdom of the Mahayana Vaipulya in one fascicle, the Sutra of the Ornament of Joyful Garlands in one fascicle, the Sutra of Unprecedented Causes and Conditions in one fascicle, the Sutra on the Non-practice of All Dharmas in one fascicle, the Sutra on the Unconditioned Way in one fascicle, the Sutra of Prince Virtue-Light in one fascicle. From the Flower Ornament Sutra up to here,
Twenty-three sutras.
All of these were lightly compiled by Xiao Ziliang, Prince of Jingling of the Southern Qi dynasty,
From his own mind.
Within the great text,
Either adding or subtracting,
Weighing and measuring to form a sutra.
Contradicting the holy teachings,
Messing up the true canon.
Therefore, it is appended to the end of the spurious,
To warn future generations.
The Sutra of the Adornments of the Family of Sarva-jÃ±a in one fascicle. The above one sutra,
The Seng You catalog states,
In the ninth year of the Tianjian era of the Liang dynasty,
The ascetic monk Miaoguang of Yingzhou,
Went to Hongpu Temple under the jurisdiction of Yangzhou,
And began to create this sutra.
Gathering disciples to deceive and confuse,
He was expelled by the Liang court.
Therefore, it is necessary to consult the classics to warn later students.

The above, from the Jewel-Peak SÅ«tra to this,
are twenty-one sÅ«tras.
In total, thirty-five fascicles.
This was at the end of the Southern Qi dynasty.
The daughter of Jiang Bi, a lecturer at the Imperial University,
a nun named Sengfa.
At the age of eight or nine,
sometimes sitting quietly,
closing her eyes and reciting.
The clergy and laity of Yangzhou,
all call it divinely inspired.
But since the scriptures are not the words of the Golden Mouth,
their meaning is not transmitted.
Even if they happen to agree,
they cannot be used as instruction.
Therefore, they are appended to the spurious collection.
The previous eighty-one scriptures,
are all called deviant from the truth.
Some begin with the golden words,
but this is not yet a prophecy.
Some first discuss worldly techniques,
but later rely on Dharma words.ğŸ”½Some cite the auspicious and inauspicious of yin and yang,
some clarify the blessings and misfortunes of spirits and ghosts.
All of these kinds,
are clearly false and deceptive.
They should now be secretly hidden away,
to save the world from trouble.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
